newsitem.title: UK: Little new inquiry quoted on sugar freight market.
newsitem.headline: Little new inquiry quoted on sugar freight market.

text.p: The sugar freight market saw little new quoted business on Thursday and shipbrokers said rates continued to be on the low side.
South Africa Sugar Association produced the only new reported order of the day, quoting for 25,000 tonnes min/max bulk sugar from Durban to Japan for 30 September/15 October.
Firmer business included Genoc, which was reported to be on subjects with its recent bulk order for 13,000 tonnes from Maputo to Marseilles for end September/early October.
Shipbrokers said Jean Lion was also on subjects with 14,000 tonnes of bulk sugar from Maceio/Recife to Tunisia or Syria.
Cargill was said to have fully fixed 14,000 tonnes of bulk sugar from north Brazil to Morocco with Egyptian, Syrian and Black Sea options for September/October dates.
